# repfun [![repfun website](reference/figures/repfun.png)](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/)

[![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-Apache_2.0-blue.svg)](https://opensource.org/license/apache-2-0)
[![Lifecycle:
experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://lifecycle.r-lib.org/articles/stages.html#experimental)
[![CRAN
status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/repfun)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=repfun)
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/GSK-Biostatistics/repfun/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/GSK-Biostatistics/repfun/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml)
[![Codecov test
coverage](https://codecov.io/gh/GSK-Biostatistics/repfun/graph/badge.svg)](https://app.codecov.io/gh/GSK-Biostatistics/repfun)

## R Reporting Functions Repository

This repository contains an R package of reporting functions that mimic
(HARP) SAS macros for clinical reporting. The package can be used to
generate TLFs (Tables, Listings, Figures). See several examples in the
[Vignettes/Articles](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/).

([back to top](#readme-top))

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## How to Use This Package

1.  Download and install the package using the zip file
    repfun_0.0.0.9000.tar.gz (in “misc” branch) or via library remotes
    (see below).
2.  Load the library in an R session.
3.  Review the function documentation under References  
    (<https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/index.html>).
4.  Identify a use case that fits your needs from the Articles  
    (<https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/index.html>).
5.  Copy and modify the Vignette code for your study.

([back to top](#readme-top))

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## General Information

- This package contains reporting functions that mimic (HARP) SAS
  macros.
- View the function documentation at:
  <https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/index.html>
- Install the package using: library(remotes);
  install_github(“GSK-Biostatistics/repfun”) or
  install.packages(‘/your/path/repfun_0.0.0.9000.tar.gz’,repos=NULL,type=‘source’)
  (see “misc” branch) or download the following zip file and install as
  above:
  <https://github.com/GSK-Biostatistics/repfun/blob/misc/repfun_0.0.0.9000.tar.gz>
- Use the package by loading it: library(repfun)
- View use cases at:
  <https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/>
- View package documentation at:
  <https://github.com/GSK-Biostatistics/repfun/blob/misc/repfun_0.0.0.9000.pdf>

([back to top](#readme-top))

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites

``` r
# Before using repfun, install the following R packages:
install.packages(c("tidyr","dplyr","ggplot2","magrittr","Hmisc","haven","stringr","admiral","lubridate","r2rtf")) 
```

# Package index

## Reporting

- [`ru_freq()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_freq.md)
  : Create Percentage based on Numerator and Denominator Data
- [`ru_sumstats()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_sumstats.md)
  : Calculate Descriptive Statistics
- [`ru_list()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_list.md)
  : R function to mimic the SAS macro %tu_list.

## Utility

- [`rs_setup()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/rs_setup.md)
  : Pass values to setup function and the global environment will be
  arranged for use reporting tools.
- [`ru_addbignvar()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_addbignvar.md)
  : Assign Big N to Data Frame.
- [`ru_addpage()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_addpage.md)
  : Add a Page Number Column to an Existing Dataframe
- [`ru_addsupp()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_addsupp.md)
  : Cobmine an SDTM domain with its corresponding Supplemental data set
- [`ru_align()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_align.md)
  : Align Columns for Reporting
- [`ru_contents()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_contents.md)
  : Generate proc contents of data frame similar to that generated by
  SAS
- [`ru_data2codelist()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_data2codelist.md)
  : Return a list with codelist, code and label based on input codelist
  dataset.
- [`ru_datacompare()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_datacompare.md)
  : Compare 2 data frames and report differences.
- [`ru_datetime()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_datetime.md)
  : Add numeric datetimes to data frame that only has character
  versions.
- [`ru_denorm()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_denorm.md)
  : Transpose a Data Frame
- [`ru_expvarlist()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_expvarlist.md)
  : Expand SAS Style Variable/Column List
- [`ru_fillcodedcode()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_fillcodedcode.md)
  : Fill missing code/decode records
- [`ru_fillna()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_fillna.md)
  : Fill NA values with specified values or zeros/blanks by default.
- [`ru_getdata()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_getdata.md)
  : Assign Big N to Data Frame.
- [`ru_groupbyvars()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_groupbyvars.md)
  : Modify groupbyvars by adding or removing decode vars.
- [`ru_labels()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_labels.md)
  : Assign labels to variables in a data frame
- [`ru_libname()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_libname.md)
  : Automate retrieval of data sets/frames in specified folder.
- [`ru_load_library()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_load_library.md)
  : Load a list of libraries
- [`ru_setdata()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_setdata.md)
  : Append data sets even when variables do not match
- [`ru_stackvar()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_stackvar.md)
  : Stack Columns of a Dataframe into New Column
- [`ru_width_rtf()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ru_width_rtf.md)
  : Create a List of Relative Widths of Columns for RTF Outputs
- [`setpath()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/setpath.md)
  : Set the current working directory.
- [`rem_pg_nums()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/rem_pg_nums.md)
  : Remove floating page numbers from RTF files.
- [`copydata()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/copydata.md)
  : Copy package data to the directory specified.

## Data

- [`adae`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/adae.md)
  : ADaM ADAE
- [`adsl`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/adsl.md)
  : ADaM ADSL
- [`advs`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/advs.md)
  : ADaM ADVS
- [`ae`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/ae.md) :
  Adverse Events
- [`dm`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/dm.md) :
  Demography
- [`suppae`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/suppae.md)
  : Supplemental Adverse Events
- [`suppdm`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/suppdm.md)
  : Supplemental Demography
- [`airquality_4test`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/airquality_4test.md)
  : Updated airquality for testing.
- [`airquality_updated`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/airquality_updated.md)
  : Updated airquality
- [`formats`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/formats.md)
  : Data frame of SAS formats
- [`mtcars_w2lbls`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/reference/mtcars_w2lbls.md)
  : This is the mtcars data frame with labels added for columns mpg and
  cyl.

- [Data-Compare](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Data-Compare.md):

- [Fill-Missings](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Fill-Missings.md):
- [Generate-Counts-and-Percents](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Generate-Counts-and-Percents.md):
- [Generate-Relative-Column-Widths-for-RTF-Reporting](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Generate-Relative-Column-Widths-for-RTF-Reporting.md):
- [Generate-Summary-Statistics](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Generate-Summary-Statistics.md):
- [Get-Data-for-Population](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Get-Data-for-Population.md):
- [Global-Reporting-Setup](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Global-Reporting-Setup.md):
- [Library-Setup](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Library-Setup.md):
- [Load-Libraries](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Load-Libraries.md):
- [Proc-Contents](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Proc-Contents.md):
- [SAS-Type-Variable-Expansion](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/SAS-Type-Variable-Expansion.md):
- [Set-Data](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Set-Data.md):
- [Stack-Variables](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/repfun/articles/Stack-Variables.md):
